name: Sofitel London Heathrow

reviews.text: This is the best hotel in London shame its at the airport. Clean rooms smiles when you check in not normal in London. Hermes toiletries. Great airport hotel the best at Heathrow airport although not cheap..
reviews.title: Best hotel in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just booked again to stay at the excellent Sofitel Heathrow. We found the welcome from the staff was friendly and attentive. Last time we stayed my car was due to be picked up by a "meet and greet" service but they were delayed. The concierge let me park the car at the front of the hotel whilst we were checked intoour room. There is normally only "drop off" stopping allowed. He kept an eye on it and telephoned our room when the "meet and greet" service had finally arrived. That's great service in my book.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with perfect location
Always surpasses expectations
reviews.text: Considering we were in a busy airport hotel, our room was very quiet and there was a peaceful feel about the place. The room and bed were really confortable so we got a great night's sleep. That's unusual for us on a night before a long flight.

We had an evening meal in Vivre, their a la carte restaurant. Watching the chefs cook the meals was interesting. It's a bit like being on set with masterchef going on and hearing them all call out in French, "Oi Chef!" as the orders were placed . It was here that I had a most delicious fillet steak. I've eaten widely in France and have to say that I was not expecting Vivre to match how the Fench cook. I was wrong and my steak was tender, delicious and perfectly cooked to how I like it. I might have been tempted to try Brasserie Roux but they were closed on the night we stayed.
reviews.title: Amazing
Great place to rest in transit
reviews.text: We had time for breakfast and this meal was also much better than expected. To be honest, we don't normally bother with hotel breakfasts as they are usually so dire. The Sofitel Heathrow breakfast on the other hand has plenty of choice and is freshly cooked. They seem to only cook a small amount of anything and replenish quicky and freshly as they begin to run out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room and breakfast for 2 persons. My receipt stated the ammount charged to my card and I was content with the charge. When I went to breakfast, I was told that I had not paid for breakfast. When I enquired at reception, I was told that breakfast had in fact, not been included. I was embarrassed in the breakfast room, as it seemed to be suggested that I had not intended to pay. We were on a leisure trip. How would it have looked to potential clients if the same situation had occurred?. Poor show Sofitel. The staff in the hotel were extremely helpful but disadvantaged by the systems failure.
reviews.title: Systems Failure

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel prior to catching a flight for a business trip from Terminal 5 the next morning.
reviews.title: Clean, modern hotel with professional service throughout
So handy for Terminal 5
reviews.text: Upon arrival, I was immediately upgraded to a King Superior room which was clean, spacious and one of the most modern hotel rooms in which I have stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, I woke up refreshed and relaxed. I took a 5 minute walk via the hotel's internal walkway directly into Terminal 5.
reviews.title: Could not have hoped for a better start to our holiday, many thanks!

reviews.text: It was the perfect stay and I will book this hotel again prior to my next business trip.
reviews.title: Food

reviews.text: Airport hotels are ones a traveler generally stays in out of necessity, rather than by choice. If you have a layover at Heathrow, this one is by far the most convenient of all airport hotels. You can't beat the location--you can enter it directly from Terminal 5 (the British Airways terminal) at Heathrow. Other nearby hotels require the use of a shuttle, taxi, or other ground transportation, but you can walk from your flight right into this one without even going outside. If you're flying into (or out of) other terminals, Terminal 5 can be reached for free on the Heathrow Express trains (there is no fare charged from terminal to terminal on that train).
reviews.title: If you need to stay at Heathrow, this is a great option

reviews.text: The hotel is quiet, which is surprising for an airport hotel. It must have great sound insulation, because inside the room I heard no jets taking off or landing at Heathrow right next door. The rooms are fairly spacious and they are nicely appointed. Obviously, Heathrow isn't in the most exciting spot and there's nothing to do around there, other than sleep, have a meal or drink, and then catch your next flight. But if you have some time to kill and want to do more, London itself is only about 20 minutes away by Heathrow Express (£32 round trip) or about 50 minutes away by Tube (under £6 round trip).
reviews.title: Still the best for one or two nights at Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not the cheapest hotel around Heathrow by any stretch of the imagination--you pay a premium for being a few steps from the terminal--but it's undoubtedly the most convenient.
reviews.title: worthwhile but only if flying from terminal 5

reviews.text: Well worth the expense and the hotel is a regular stopover for me.
reviews.title: Marvellous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night for a hefty 116 GBP, even though booked and paid in full months in advance. Atmosphere posh but antiseptic. Felt like another planet. Long walk from the terminal through a series of corridors, down an escalator to check-in, short stroll to the oddly-located lifts, back up in the glass box, down a long corridor and across a bridge above a weird sort of ersatz Zen garden, down two more long corridors, and into our room at last. Quiet throughout the night and bed exceedingly comfortable. Fussy lighting controls, impossible to manage in the dark, a triumph of designer chic over common sense. Staying here could be worthwhile if you have an early flight out of terminal 5, but otherwise forget it. I flew from terminal 3 and could have arrived there more quickly by staying outside the airport, rather than dragging myself from the Sofitel to the Heathrow express, waiting fifteen minutes for the train to arrive, riding the train for ten minutes, and then hiking to my flight check-in.
reviews.title: amazing service

reviews.text: This is a hugely comfortable, efficient hotel. Large rooms, generous bathrooms and quiet space. There is no outside light but when jet-lagged this can be helpful/hinder.
reviews.title: God overnight stay/business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast never felt crowded and was of a good quality. The only downside is the vastness with lack of directions - on more than one occasion my colleagues and I were left hunting the room number.
reviews.title: Great place to bein your holiday

reviews.text: Otherwise a big recommend for business travellers.
reviews.title: forgot to clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have used this hotel 3 times now and we are always impressed by the quality and convenience it offers. Being a Sofitel Platinum member, I am always upgraded to the next best room - which is a great bonus as it means we get access to the Club Millesime for evening drinks and canapes and an early breakfast.
reviews.title: Will keep coming back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is of couse onlysuper convenient if you are flying from terminal five but since we nearly always fly with BA then this very much suits our needs. I particularly like the fact that you can park in the short stay car park and then walk to reception (it really isn't that far!) and of course you then get to walk to your flight in the morning - easy!
reviews.title: A few problems in the details, but overall not bad

reviews.text: If you don't want to pay the restaurant prices (and they can be very expensive if you add wine etc) then I recommend a quick trip to terminal 5 to the Marks and Spencer Simply Food shop - great for a quick salad or sandwich to go.
reviews.title: Excellent location for T5 but at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel overall is more sterile than many Sofitel properties but we do always get a very warm welcome from the staff and as I don't appreciate being "fussed" over this suits me just fine.
reviews.title: Spacious, comfortable hotel for airport travellers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, give it a go - the rooms are beautiful with TVs in the bathrooms and incredibly comfy beds. No noise from the planes parked just outside either. If you want a night of rest before a trip I recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Great Way to Start a Holiday

reviews.text: I was flying out the next day from Heathrow Terminal 5 and wanted somewhere close to the terminal as I travelled to Heathrow by train (which was very easy with th Heathrow Express) and didn't want the hassle of an airport bus the next day.
reviews.title: Great Location and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I therefore chose this hotel because of it's location (it has a direct walkthrough to Terminal 5 ) and the great reviews.
reviews.title: Not your usual airport hotel
Very nice rooms, great breakfast buffet
reviews.text: It's not cheap (I got the room on a 'room only' rate) but the room was spacious, they have an LCD TV on the wall, the bathroom was modern and luxurious. The whole room was immaculate. The bed was in a class of it's own. So comfortable and I had a great night's sleep.

reviews.title: Chincy chincy airport hotel---too bad it's the Sofitel
reviews.text: The room was very well soundproofed with thick window glass so even though I had a great view of the planes taking off, I couldn't hear them. Th room temperature was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is quite big and ultra modern and has a couple of restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel, one before our holiday and one the day we returned plus the parking deal. As we booked in March we got an early booking discount (because we asked!) but even better on our return trip we got a free upgrade to a luxury room. As a lowly leisure traveller, I don't get to stay in 5 star hotels very often and this was a treat as it was a trip of a lifetime for me. It was fabulous, the rooms are great, really quiet so you get loads of sleep, with the best beds ever and big bathrooms. The staff are brilliant, check in & out is quick, porters on hand to move your luggage etc.... Tea 5 serves great cake, the bars are good, Sphere is very atmospheric when it gets busy. We didn't eat in the main restaurant as we'd gone up to the airport and decided to eat there instead but it looked really nice. There was a Microsoft convention going on one night but this hotel is so big that you didn't feel that you'd been hijacked by coporate geekdom! The location is great too, if you are flying out of T5 you can't get a better place as you are directly linked to the airport. T5 works well now by the way, the teething problems seem to have been resolved, I have never been through an airport so quickly.
reviews.title: What a treat

reviews.text: Summary: This hotel is literally attached to the Heathrow airport, so you can walk to the terminals at the airport. Which is great if you have an early/late flight or are conducting business near Heathrow. It is also attached to the Metro stop at Heathrow so you can catch a long (40 minutes) train ride into the center of London.
reviews.title: Good hotel for business near Heathrow or a late/early flight, close to the Metro.

reviews.text: Pros: Clean, modern hotel, good location at Heathrow. The breakfast area is also large and serves a quite nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Best choice in Heathrow

reviews.text: Cons: Far from central London (I would not recommend staying here if you plan to sightsee in London).
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel: Bit pricey though!

reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend this hotel to you if your travels or business require you to be close to Heathrow. If you plan to sightsee in London, stay at a more centrally located hotel (like the Hotel 41, which I've also reviewed and highly recommend).
reviews.title: A comfortable and convenient way to relax after a transatlantic flight

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel London Heathrow in transit from Frankfurt to Hong Kong/Sydney as my flight was leaving London at mid-day. I arrived at about 9 pm from Frankfurt and found the hotel quite easily after asking for directions. Take the lift down to the first floor of the Terminal 5 complex and follow the signs! It is less than 5 minutes walk and you can use a trolley almost all the way. Do be aware that the last bit of the walk is without trolleys but there is a lift at one point that takes you to Reception.
reviews.title: So convenient and surprisingly quiet

reviews.text: The Reception staffer was very friendly and welcoming and because I had pre-paid for the room check-in was very quick. You need to use your key to get the lift to move but it is very easy. The hotel is spread out along 4 'wings' but the signage makes it easy to find your room. Mine had a view of the escalators from the Terminal to the hotel, so not a picture postcard view out the window, but given my reasons for staying there it made no difference to me. The room was very very quiet and fully appointed. L'Occitance products and TV speakers in the bathroom, very comfortable large bed and great sheets.
reviews.title: wow

reviews.text: I didn't have breakfast in the hotel (instead I went into Terminal 5) but the room service menu looked sufficiently pricey to miss. Carluccio's is a great substitute!
reviews.title: Great experience again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are in need of a night or two very close to the airport, even if you are flying out of Terminals 1, 3 or 4 (I was flying out of T3), the Sofitel is a great option. This sort of experience is ideal for the long-haul traveller who wants a decent night's sleep before 20+ hours of flying to the Southern Hemisphere!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: its been a while since i was wowed by a hotel, it seemed like a hidden gem as a lot of the rooms were empty, but it had quiet understated elegance
reviews.title: OK Stay - Club Millesime a great disappointment

reviews.text: Arrived back from Hong Kong at 5am so wanted somewhere to relax & freshen up before catching a flight later in the day to Edinburgh. Booked through www.airmiles.co.uk for one night which included breakfast. Great location at T5 for arrivals & departures. Check in was very quick & the room was perfect, all very new & contemporary. Went for breakfast to be told our name wasn't on the list & we'd have to pay. Went back to the desk where they immediately rectified the problem & explained that it was becaus the list is printed the night before & as we checked in early the following morning we were missed off. The buffet was excellent & set us up for the day. Would recommend this hotel either before or after a flight.
reviews.title: Return flight

reviews.text: I booked my room through Lastminute.com's Secret Hotels scheme so didn't pay much for the room booking itself - however, I arrived on a flight from Australia early in the morning so needed an early check-in, for which I was charged £10 an hour, almost doubling the cost of my stay. Still, the room was luxurious, very quiet indeed (I was on the ground floor, the other side of the "Zen garden"), with a very comfortable bed (the mattresses are soft, with high pillows, but you can request different pillows if you wish) and overall I did enjoy my stay. As others have recommended, I bought some really nice food and wine from the M&S in Terminal 5 and picnicked in my room for both dinner and breakfast (there's a fridge in the room so you can store food, and there are basic tea & coffee-making facilities too). I spent the day in London and access was easy and cheap via a 6-zone Tube travelcard, though it took the best part of an hour on the Piccadilly Line into Central London. The staff were a bit impersonal but courteous. Overall I'd recommend this hotel, particularly if you don't need an early check-in (normal check-in time is 1400). Otherwise, be prepared to pay extra. I didn't try the spa facilities - I would have loved a swim after my long flight, but strangely this hotel doesn't have a swimming pool.
reviews.title: Good value for money via Lastminute.com's Secret Hotels, but watch extra charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a gem of a place to break a journey. Right next to Terminal 5 but so quiet. Fab room with big comfy bed and wonderful bathroom. Love the zen garden. Great choices at breakfast too. Worth paying that bit extra, but we were upgraded which is always a treat!
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel at Heathrow Terminal 5 was by far our best 5* airport-hotel.
reviews.title: Best airport-hotel so far

reviews.text: Coming from a 14-hour-flight from Singapore and being annoyed by chaotic Heathrow airport (getting from T3 to T5 also took a while) we experienced a warm welcome and a great, personal service at the front desk.
reviews.title: Convenient Location - Indifferent Service

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel Hotel in Terminal 5 in Heathrow the night before leaving on an early morning flight. My husband had booked the stay online and then had confirmed that we had an interconnecting room for our children the day before we stayed. The hotel was nice and new, but the staff member on reception were less than helpful. they could no longer offer interconnecting rooms and wanted me to pay another £50 to get a family room. I phoned my husband who had done the booking and he eventually got through to reception and eventually sorted out the problem. However, it took over an hour to check in at 8.30pm with a very tired 4 and a 6 year old. The hotel is expensive and in the end when the invoice arrived as we did the quick check out they had added another £100 to the bill! The room was nice, comfortable and very well equipped but for a big hotel it was dissapointing service.
reviews.title: Nightmare customer services
Wowzer
reviews.text: Super posh hotel located brilliantly in Terminal 5. Fast track to every where in every mode of transportation.
I stayed one night at the hotel and was extremely impressed with check-in and with the room and all of its furnishings. The room was most comfortable and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Excellent room and good value

reviews.text: I'll definitely be staying here when I'm next staying at Heathrow.
reviews.title: An Absolute Oasis!

I decided to check it out and see if they could offer me a competitive rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are excellent, and the initial teething problems with the Bose systems not working correctly now seem fixed. Shower pressure in the Imperial is not as good as the other rooms, and the body jets are not operable at the same time as the overhead shower. Shower in the other rooms are excellent, although some of the Operas have an incorrectly set temperature hard stop that means the shower can only be lukewarm at max temp.

reviews.text: Sound proofing is outstanding with no exterior noise detectable at all, notwithstanding an approach/departure facing exterior room.
reviews.title: Lovely staff - relaxed easy hotel !!! Try it !!!
Park and fly
reviews.text: Excellent access to T5 through the corridor, but its a long schlep to Security South / F / J check in, with an odd sloping floor on the corridor that alternates its slope left and right as you progress.

reviews.title: THE Best Transit Hotel Anywhere Near London Heathrow
reviews.text: If you have to transit through London, this is the hotel for you. The convenience of the Sofitel Terminal 5 via Heathrow Express between terminals made this a very seamless journey to our hotel upon our arrival at Terminal 3. Other hotels within the area require shuttle buses (Hoppa Bus) with drivers that are lazy and have rotten attitudes. My prior experience with local Heathrow hotels is that rooms are old, small, and not updated to meet the needs of today's savvy travelers. Sofitel exceeded my expectations and provided ample room where you didn't feel as if you were sleeping in a hotel's broom closet. Don't waste your time saving a couple of pounds for offsite locations. A good night's rest will make you very pleased that you chose this hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Premium hotel located in Terminal 5 of LHR; had a very specific itinerary which had me flying into Terminal 5 (which made this Sofitel London Heathrow very convenient) and allowed for an immediate check in (despite an extra charge for early check-in at 8AM) and much-needed nap. A 6:45 AM flight the following morning out of Terminal 3 necessitated staying within this location despite a night trip into downtown London.
reviews.title: Prime location if you have an early morning departure

reviews.text: Things I appreciated: very nice Tea5 lounge, great gym equipment and room, superb concerge staff, sound-proof rooms allowed for a great sleep
reviews.title: Great location, but not very exciting. Apart from the food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things to watch out for: my cab to Knightsbridge via taxi cost 90 GBP with tip. If possible, take the Heathrow Express into Paddington Station (which I did coming back). Taxi trip to Terminal 3 at 4:30 AM cost 17GBP. TO GO TO AN ADJACENT TERMINAL. Terminal 3 does NOT start functioning until 5:00 AM so if you can wait for the 5:07 Heathrow Express from Terminal 5 to Terminal 3, then do so.
reviews.title: A pretense of luxury, but a very different reality

description: Only Heathrow Airport hotel with direct access to Terminal 5 via a covered walkway and Terminals 1, 2, 3 / Terminal 4 via courtesy Heathrow Express/ Connect rail connection and only 21 minutes from Central London by train. Sofitel London Heathrow boasts 605 non-smoking bedrooms including 27 suites. All rooms include the famous Sofitel MyBed, plasma screen TV and double glazed windows (rooms facing outside have triple glazing). All bathroom include separate walk in shower and bath. For your meetings and events, the hotel's conference centre boasts 45 meeting rooms including three executive boardrooms, a tiered theatre and a main room for up to 1,300 delegates. The hotel Food and Beverage outlets include: La Belle Epoque - gourmet French cuisine with contemporary world influences; Vivre - with its open theatre kitchens, Sphere Bar, the Library Bar and the Tea 5 salon. Leisure facilities include the hotel's Zen Garden, a 24-hour Gym as well as a hydro suite with Vitality pool, sauna and steam room (chargeable). A hair salon is located on the ground floor. For travellers arriving by car, the hotel offers on-site underground car park as well as Park & Fly packages for up to 15 days. we do also offer transportation to and from the hotel.
